Auf der Landkarte kannst du die Teamansicht öffnen, indem du entweder die I-Taste drückst oder die untere Info-Leiste angeklickst, um dort deine Charaktere zu heilen, auszurüsten oder aufzuleveln.
Hat ein Gefecht erst einmal begonnen, kannst du die Ausrüstung deiner Charaktere nicht mehr austauschen. Entscheide dich vorher!
Jede Waffe und Rüstungsart gewährt eine einzigartige Spezialaktion, die den Unterschied zwischen Sieg und Niederlage ausmachen kann.
Verliert einer deiner Charaktere im Gefecht das Bewusstsein, so kannst du ihn wiederbeleben, indem du zu ihm gehst und ihn mit Erster Hilfe versorgst. Warte nicht zu lange, die Zeit tickt!
Erste-Hilfe-Gegenstände können ausserhalb von Gefechten in der Teamansicht per Rechtsklick zur Heilung verletzter Charaktere benutzt werden.
Verkaufe deine überzählige Beute bei Händlern per Rechtsklick. Das Geld kannst du gut gebrauchen!
Behalte deine Munitions- und Benzinbestände gut im Blick. Geht dir das eine oder das andere aus, dann hast du ein Problem!

Jedes Expeditionsmitglied kann pro Zug zwei Aktionen ausführen. Es gibt drei Aktionsarten: Angriff, Bewegung und Neutral. Ein Charakter kann nur einmal pro Runde angreifen oder sich bewegen, doch bis zu zwei neutrale Aktionen ausführen.
Deckungen verringern die Wahrscheinlichkeit, ein Ziel zu treffen. Hast du jedoch freie Schussbahn auf ein ungedecktes Ziel, so triffst du immer. Flankiere daher deine Gegner so of wie möglich!
Nutze Mauern und andere große Objekte zu deinem Vorteil, um die Sichtlinie deiner Gegner zu brechen.
Rüstungen absorbieren Schaden für gewöhnlich immer zuerst. Sie sind besonders effektiv gegen Waffen wie Schrotflinten, die Splitterschaden hervorrufen.
Unabhängig von der jeweiligen Trefferwahrscheinlichkeit hast du eine gewisse Chance, den Angriffen deiner Gegner auszuweichen.

Jeder Charakter kann drei Gegenstände gleichzeitig ausrüsten: Eine Waffe, einen anderen Gegenstand und eine Rüstung. Die Wahl der passenden Ausrüstung bestimmt weite Teile deiner taktischen Optionen im Gefecht!
Jeder Charakter verfügt über individuelle Fähigkeiten. Im Laufe der Zeit gewinnt er ausserdem an Erfahrung und kann so neue Talente erlernen bzw. alte verbessern.
Will ein Charakter einen bestimmten Gegenstand ausrüsten, so benötigt er das dazugehörige Talent.
Manche Perks eröffnen in den Ereignissen neue Wahlmöglichkeiten: Solche Zusatzoptionen sind farblich hervorgehoben.
Pistolen gewähren die Spezialaktion Hüftschuss, mit der man zwei verschiedene Gegner beschiessen kann!
Mit Präzisionsgewehren kann ein Hinterhalt gelegt werden. Ein Gegner, der sich innerhalb des Hinterhaltbereichs bewegt oder einen Angriff ausführen will, wird automatisch beschossen!
Sturmgewehre erlauben eine Schnellfeuergarbe. Diese bestreicht mehrere Gegner in gerader Linie.
Schrotflinten können einen Streuschuss machen, der alle Einheiten unmittelbar vor dem Schützen erfasst.
Messer verfügen über die Sonderaktion Blutung, die Feinde im Verlauf einiger Runden ausbluten lässt.

Alle Spezialaktionen kosten Mutpunkte. Diese werden im Gefecht regeneriert, wann immer ein Charakter erfolgreich angreift oder ausweicht bzw. wenn er sich oder andere heilt oder deren Rüstungen repariert.
Messer verursachen den potenziell höchsten Schaden im Spiel. Allerdings setzen sie unmittelbare Nähe zum Gegner voraus mit allen Risiken, die daran hängen!
In manchen Gefechten liegen mysteriöse Fässer verstreut. Schiess auf sie, um nahestehende Feinde in Flammen aufgehen zu lassen!
Verbandszeug regeneriert Gesundheit und kann benutzt werden, um Bewusstlose wiederzubeleben. Handwerksmaterialien reparieren beschädigte Rüstungen.
Du kannst deine Aktionen im Gefecht in beliebiger Reihenfolge durchführen!
Vergiss nicht, nach einem gewonnenen Gefecht deine Beute einzusammeln!
Messer sind eine gute Rückversicherung, falls dir mal die Munition ausgeht!
Leichte Rüstungen erlauben die Spezialaktion Sprinten, mit der dein Charakter deutlich größere Distanzen zurücklegen kann.
Mittere Rüstungen gewähren die Spezialaktion Abtauchen. Wird diese aktiviert, so erhält der Charakter einen zeitweiligen Ausweichbonus.
Schwere Rüstungen gestatten es einem Charakter, sich niederzukauern. Sein erlittener Schaden wird dadurch zeitweilig erheblich verringert.
Wenn dein Charakter keine Aktionen mehr ausführen kann, dann erscheint ein kleines Häkchen über seinem Kopf.
Die wichtigsten Kampfwerte aller Einheiten werden über deren Köpfen angezeigt.
Willst du auf der Landkarte erste Informationen über einen Ort bekommen, so bewege einfach deinen Mauszeiger über ihn.
Rastplätze, Händler und hilfsbereite Freunde können erneut besucht werden.
Befindest du dich an einem Ort, der wiederbesucht werden kann (beispielsweise bei einem Händler), so klicke das Ereignis einfach nochmal an, um es erneut zu öffnen.

[h1]Background[/h1]The year is 1936 and Nazi activity is increasing in intensity by the day.
Tirelessly, they send their expeditions into the vastness of the deserts and the inhospitable mountains of the Middle East.
North Africa, Arabia - what could the armies of evil be looking for?
[p][img:codex_atmoshot]
[p][h1]Every expedition is different[/h1]In Pathway, you send a group of intrepid adventurers on perilous expeditions. They must win turn-based battles, uncover ancient secrets, and manage their fuel supplies to ensure they arrive in time to thwart the evil plans of their merciless enemies.
Every expedition is different in Pathway. This is because – in addition to a basic outline  – expeditions are always assigned a random series of new events. Even events that you may have encountered before can take unexpected turns, either through chance or because of the different composition of your team.
[p][h1]Persistent gameplay[/h1]Even a defeat means progress in Pathway, as characters gain experience even when they fail. Over the course of individual adventures, characters will gain enough experience and equipment to attempt increasingly risky undertakings.
Manage your expedition! Make use of the strengths of its individual members! Make the right decisions on the events you experience during your journey!
[p][h1]Every decision counts[/h1]The world is on the brink of disaster. An undeclared war rages in the shadows! Victory or defeat – only you and your unsung heroes can decide the outcome!
[p][img:codex_armor]

[h1]Key Bindings[/h1]As you progress through the codex, you will learn in detail how to play Pathway. Additionally, you can configure key bindings under Options / Controls. By default, key bindings are defined as described below:
[p][h1]Map[/h1]I: Open Team Screen
[p][h1]Team Screen[/h1]Right-click on weapon: Reload
Right-click on medkit: Heal / revive character
Right-click on repairkit: Repair armor
Right-click on any item: Drop item
[p][h1]Map / Battle[/h1]WASD: Move camera
Press Space + LMB: Free camera move
[p][h1]Battle[/h1]Right arrow: Next own unit
Left arrow: Previous own unit
Return: End turn
1: Standard ranged attack
2: Special ranged attack
3: Standard knife attack
4: Special knife attack
5: Use item
F: Armor-related special action
R: Reload
B: Fist Punch
LMB: Initiate action
RMB: Abort action
[p][h1]Trader[/h1]Right-click on own item: Sell item
Right-click or left-click on trader item: Buy item

[h1]Teams and adventures[/h1]Pathway consists of a series of individual adventures that gradually increase in difficulty. At the start of an adventure, you need to assemble a team from the total available unlocked and uninjured characters.
The number of characters in your team depends on the adventure.
[p][img:codex_teamselect]
[p][h1]Unlocking New Adventures[/h1]At the start of the game, all adventures are locked apart from the starting adventure. Each completed adventure automatically unlocks the next adventure.

[h1]Jeep Storage[/h1]Once you have assembled your team, you can equip your characters with new items, provided there is loot from previous adventures.
[p][img:codex_jeepstorage]
[p]Items not needed by your team can be moved to the valuables bag to clear inventory space. Just right-click on any given item. Items in the valuables bag can be sold to a trader at a later point. Beware: This action is irrevocable!
[p]Besides that, you can permanently upgrade your jeep's fuel and ammo capacity. This option costs money and is thus only available when you have sufficient funds.

[h1]Equipment Slots[/h1]You can equip a character’s first equipment slot with either a ranged weapon or a melee weapon. You can equip a character’s second slot with either a melee weapon or another item. These other items can be hand grenades, medkits and repairkits. The third slot is intended exclusively for armor.
[p][img:codex_itemslots]

[h1]Recruit Info[/h1]When you select a character, their character stats are displayed to the right, along with a brief summary of their strengths and weaknesses. The three colored bars immediately to the right of the character portrait indicate their health (red), armor value (blue), and bravery (orange).
[p][img:codex_character]

[h1]Character Stats[/h1]In addition to their equipment, characters also have different character stats:
[p][img:codex_charstats]
[p][h1]Vitality (VIT)[/h1]Determines a character’s health.
[p][h1]Willpower (WIL)[/h1]Determines a character’s bravery points. Bravery is needed for special actions.
[p][h1]Dexterity (DEX)[/h1]Affects accuracy for ranged attacks.
[p][h1]Agility (AGI)[/h1]Affects how far a character can move on their turn.
[p][h1]Intelligence (INT)[/h1]Affects how many experience points a character receives. The higher the value, the faster a character progresses.
[p][h1]Reflexes (RFX)[/h1]Affects the probability that a character can dodge an attack.
[p][h1]Endurance (END)[/h1]Affects the number of turns that an unconscious character remains alive.

[h1]Perks[/h1]Perks further distinguish your characters, giving them various advantages and disadvantages.
[p][img:codex_perklist]
[p][h1]Skills[/h1]Left-click on a character’s skill button to open the Skill View.
[p][h1]Item Skills[/h1]Item skills define which items a character may equip. Skill icons with a green plus sign give advantages, while the ones with red minus signs have certain disadvantages.
Skills that have both advantages and disadvantages are indicated with a red-green icon.
[p][img:codex_itemskills]
[p][h1]Skill Tree and Leveling Up[/h1]Left-click on the Skill Tree button to open the Skill Tree. Every time a character levels up, they gain a new advantage that they can choose from the options in the Skill Tree. Your character can improve their stats and skills or learn how to use new items.
[p][img:codex_skilltree]

[h1]Unlocking New Characters[/h1][img:codex_unlock01]
[p]You start the game with a limited number of playable characters. Additional characters are unlocked during the game whenever you meet certain conditions. The precise conditions for each character are displayed when you left-click on them or read the achievements list.
[p][img:codex_unlock02]

[h1]Hospitalized characters and recovery[/h1][img:codex_hospitalized01]
[p]Characters who are incapacitated during an adventure are locked for the next expedition, as they need to recover from their injuries. You can pay cash to buy better medical care and reduce their time in the hospital.
[p][img:codex_hospitalized02]

[h1]Gaining experience and equipment[/h1]Regardless of the outcome of an adventure, every participating character keeps the experience points and items they gain. Only cancelling an adventure will reset any experience points and items gained by all participating characters during that adventure.

[h1]Achievements[/h1]You can access your trophies from the tab on the bottom right of this Codex Screen. These trophies represent all the achievements you can complete in Pathway. Move the cursor over an achievement to see its name and the actions required to unlock it.
[p]Every unlocked achievement grants a reward; this is also described in the tooltip. Each reward can be claimed either immediately when an achievement is unlocked or later by left-clicking on the achievement on the Trophy Screen.
[p][img:codex_achievements]

[h1]Basics[/h1]Overland travel is depicted in Pathway as a series of events on a map: Every location that your expedition travels to on the map has its own event. Accessible locations (green) are connected by a dashed travel line to the current location of your characters (orange). Locations and travel lines already visited by your team are also displayed in orange.
[p][img:codex_travelnodes]
[p]Overland travel involves some strategic planning (e.g. careful allocation of travel resources, choice of a travel route that meets the goals of your expedition).
[p]The objective of every journey is to reach the corresponding destination. To complete the corresponding adventure, your travelers must arrive at this location. Longer adventures can consist of several maps that are linked via individual destinations.
[p]Although each map has a specific pattern of travel lines, no journey is the same as the next, as your events are redetermined at the beginning of each adventure. However, each adventure has its own events that drive the story of that individual adventure, as well as the overarching narrative.

[h1]Travel Resources[/h1]Travel from one location to another costs one unit of fuel. When the expedition’s fuel supply is used up, you may either admit defeat or attempt to make it through the inhospitable desert on foot. Such an endeavor will drain the characters‘ health rapidly. The exact damage taken is dependant on each individual‘s endurance. If you manage to find new fuel in the near future, you will be able to resume the journey with the jeep. Otherwise, your expedition will end in failure.
[p][img:codex_travelresources]
[p]When your characters have used up all their ammunition, they will be forced to resort to knives, fists, and grenades.
[p]The expedition needs money to replenish its stocks of fuel and equipment, as well as to hire new recruits.
[p]Some characters have perks that boost the number of resources you capture.

[h1]Event Icons[/h1]Events on the map are typically displayed as round symbols. A range of special events do have their own unique icons, though:
[p][h1]Destination[/h1][img:codex_destination]
[p]The destination of your journey, unlike the other possible travel locations, is indicated with a cross rather than a circle. The icon depicts a flag on a cross.
[p][h1]Battles[/h1][img:codex_battle]
[p]Events where you can expect to do battle are indicated by a crosshair icon.
All traveling companions that survive and are fully conscious at the end of a battle receive experience points based on the individual character’s intelligence as well as the number of enemies defeated.
[p][h1]Resting Places[/h1][img:codex_restingplace]
[p]Resting places allow you to recover health and repair armor for your expedition. Unconscious characters will heal completely here. Resting places are marked on the map with a tent icon. You can visit resting places as many times as you like.
[p][h1]New Recruits[/h1][img:codex_recruiter]
[p]Locations where you can hire new team members are indicated with an icon depicting a friendly potential recruit. If your expedition does not hire the character, you can still do so by returning to the location later on.
[p][h1]Traders[/h1][img:codex_trader]
[p]Traders are indicated on the map with a money bag. In addition to fuel and ammunition, traders also sell other valuable items. You can visit each trader as often as you like.
[p]Buy and sell:
[p]Right-click on your own items to sell them to a trader.
You can right-click or left-click to buy an item from a trader.
[h1]Event Icons and Visibility[/h1]When an expedition enters a new map, you can only see a random number of events, providing you with an initial basis for planning your journey.

[h1]Event Outcomes[/h1]The results of individual events can vary, as the consequences of player decisions are determined randomly.
[p]Some characters have perks that unlock alternative solutions.
[p][img:codex_perkchoice]
[p]As a rule of thumb, the probability of success for these perk decisions is always higher than for the standard options. Characters who use an event perk successfully will also gain a substantial amount of experience points.
[p]Perk decisions are usually clearly displayed as an option. They can, however, also operate in the background as a hidden mechanism that is triggered only if one of the expedition members has the relevant event perk. The effects of multiple event perks do not stack.

[h1]Ancient Languages[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on the character’s ability to decipher ancient languages or to understand local dialects.
[p][h1]Daredevil[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on quick-thinking, unorthodox, and often rash actions.
[p][h1]Brute[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on the application of brute force.
[p][h1]Shadow[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on stealth and general athletic prowess.
[p][h1]Medical Expert[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on medical knowledge that goes beyond the ability to apply improvised bandages.
[p][h1]Engineer[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on technical knowledge.
[p][h1]Trickster[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on sleight of hand and manipulating the unsuspecting.
[p][h1]Sixth Sense[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on intuition and situational awareness.
[p][h1]Intimidation[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on the ability to exert psychological pressure on others.
[p][h1]Survivalist[/h1]Enables alternative decisions based on in-depth knowledge of the natural environment, including weather conditions and the characteristics of various wildlife.
[p][h1]Forbidden Lore[/h1]Enables alternative decisions that start where school learning ends and the gray area of mystical traditions begins.

[h1]Team Screen[/h1]Left-clicking on the lower info bar during an overland journey takes you to the Team Screen where you can heal characters and repair their armor between battles.
[p][img:codex_teamopen]
[p]This is done by right-clicking on a medkit or repairkit. The desired target person is then selected via LMB. You can reload weapons by right-clicking on them and also drag and drop items to swap them between the jeep storage and the characters.
[p][img:codex_repair]
[p]Characters can only equip items when they are not in combat. Right-click on any item to drop it. Left-clicking on a character portrait will open the corresponding character view.

[h1]Leveling Up[/h1]A small icon on the lower info bar indicates that a character has leveled up.
[p][img:codex_levelup]
[p]You can upgrade the character in the team screen by left-clicking on the Level Up button over the corresponding character.
[p][img:codex_levelupbutton]
[p]The game then opens the character’s skill tree where you can choose their new advantage.

[h1]Item Rarities[/h1]An item‘s rarity indicates its excellence: rare items are overall better than common ones. Thus, with ascending rarity the worth of an item increases as well.
There are four categories of rarity in Pathway: Common (white), Rare (blue), Epic (purple), and Legendary (golden).
[p][img:codex_itemlegendary]

[h1]Character Placement[/h1]At the beginning of a battle, you start by placing all characters within the green area.
[p][img:codex_placement]
[p]The size and shape of the green area depends on the type of encounter: If your expedition surprises the enemy or in encounters that neither side was expecting, you will have an extensive starting area. But if your characters are ambushed, they will have less space for deployment.

[h1]Enemy Info[/h1]During the placement phase, you can view the Enemy Info for all enemies within the field of vision of your characters. During the course of the battle, you can click on the tabs on the left to alternate between the Character Actions and the Enemy Info. Left-clicking on an enemy portrait will focus the camera on the corresponding unit.
[p][img:codex_enemyinfo]

[h1]Character Selection[/h1]During combat, you select a character by left-clicking on it or on its character portrait at the bottom left.
[p][img:codex_charselect]

[h1]Types of Cover[/h1]When a character is placed directly next to cover, this is indicated as a tooltip. A character that stops immediately adjacent to cover will automatically crouch down and benefit from its protection - diagonal contact with cover does not provide any protection.
[p][h1]Example[/h1][img:codex_coveruse]
[p]Brunhilda (kneeling, left) is directly next to the cover to her south. This grants her protection from all attacks from the south.
Jackson (standing, right), is only diagonally adjacent to the cover on his right. Therefore, he is not protected.
[p]Pathway distinguishes between two types of cover. Walls also provide very effective protection.

[h1]Weak Cover[/h1]Weak cover lowers the probability of being hit by a ranged attack by [cover:SmallCover]%. It also provides complete protection from grenade shrapnel. The protection radius includes all frontal attacks. It does not break line of sight and can be jumped over. Characters crouching behind weak cover stand up automatically if they want to shoot over it. Grenades can be thrown over weak cover, nullifying its protection. Solid objects up to about knee height and higher objects made of less resistant material are considered to be weak cover. Weak cover is displayed as a half-full shield in the tooltip.
[p][img:codex_weakcover]
[p][h1]Strong cover[/h1]Strong cover behaves in much the same way as weak cover, but it lowers the probability of being hit by a ranged attack by [cover:MediumCover]%. Solid objects between hip and shoulder height are considered to be strong cover. Strong cover is displayed as a full shield in the tooltip.
[p][img:codex_strongcover]

[h1]Walls[/h1]Walls provide complete protection from all ranged attacks carried out from the other side of the wall. The protected area includes all frontal attacks. It is not possible to jump over walls or throw hand grenades over them. If a wall is located along a direct line between two tiles, it breaks the line of sight. Characters standing at the edge of a wall automatically take a side step to shoot past that edge, if necessary to hit their target. Solid objects of shoulder height or higher are considered walls. Walls are displayed in the tooltip as a segment of wall.
[p][img:codex_wall]

[h1]Protected Areas and Hit Probabilities[/h1]In Pathway, a visible target that is not in cover and within range is always hit during ranged combat. For ranged combat targets behind weak and strong cover, the hit probability is calculated using a formula that takes into account the type of cover, the accuracy of the weapon and the dexterity of the shooter. Attacks from adjacent tiles cancel out the protective effects of cover. This is why melee attacks always hit.
[p][h1]Example[/h1][img:codex_coverangle]
[p]The Nazi stormtrooper has cover protection from all attacks from the south.
Because Annabelle (bottom right, pilot’s cap) is positioned to the south of him, her chance to hit is reduced accordingly.
Natalya (top right, lab coat), however, is at the same level as the German soldier. She, and all units positioned to the north would have a clear shot.
Georgette (left, kneeling) is positioned to the south of the soldier, but she is also in a directly adjacent tile, thereby negating the protective effects of his cover.

[h1]Character actions[/h1]Combat in Pathway is turn based. Pressing the red button at the end of the action bar ends your turn and begins the enemy turn.
[p][img:codex_endturn]
[p]Each character may perform a maximum of two actions per turn: This can include a maximum of one attack action and one movement action, as well as up to two neutral actions. A character that has used up all their actions is indicated with a small checkmark.
[p]All actions other than walking are equipment dependent. Actions are carried out by left-clicking on the corresponding action button. If this action is connected to a follow-up action (e.g. target selection), you can still cancel the action by right-clicking.

[h1]Special Actions[/h1]Some attack and movement actions are special actions and use bravery points.
A character will regenerate bravery points as a result of the following:
[p]A successful attack on an enemy: +[bravery:Hit] bravery
Critical hit on an enemy: +[bravery:HitCritical] bravery
Successfully evade an enemy attack: +[bravery:Evade] bravery
Heal yourself or a friend: +[bravery:UseMedKit] bravery
Repair your armor or that of a friend: +[bravery:UseRepairKit] bravery

[h1]Walk[/h1][img:codex_walk]
[p]Any activated character can move by moving the cursor to the desired location within the character’s movement radius (blue) and then left-clicking.
[p]If you find yourself making moves by mistake you may activate an additional confirm click before a movement action is executed. This can be enabled in the game options by activating the "Confirm Move" toggle.
[p][h1]Sprint (Special)[/h1][img:codex_sprint]
[p]Any character with light armor can perform the Sprint special action, granting them a significant movement bonus.

[h1]Ranged Attack[/h1][img:codex_ranged]
[p]Any character equipped with a loaded ranged weapon can perform the Ranged Attack standard action. To do this, position the cursor over an enemy within the character’s field of fire (red) and left-click to trigger the attack. The field of fire is defined by the character’s weapon range and field of vision. The tooltip displays the target’s most important combat values, as well as your hit probability.
[p][h1]Double Shot (Special)[/h1][img:codex_doubleshot]
[p]Any character with a pistol can perform the Double Shot special action, which allows two quick shots at two different targets. To do this, you select two enemies and left-click them to trigger the attacks.
[p][h1]Burst Fire (Special)[/h1][img:codex_rifleburst]
[p]Any character with an assault rifle can perform the Burst Fire special action, which allows you to attack multiple targets in a straight line. You use the mouse wheel to define the direction of fire and left-click to trigger it.
[p][h1]Ambush (Special)[/h1][img:codex_ambush]
[p]Any character with a sniper rifle can perform the Ambush special action, which impedes enemy actions within a previously defined area. You move the cursor to define the field of fire and left-click to confirm it. The ambush is then triggered during the subsequent enemy turn when an enemy unit tries to move or perform an attack within the defined field of fire.
[p][h1]Shotgun Blast (Special)[/h1][img:codex_blast]
[p]Any character with a shotgun can perform the Shotgun Blast special action, which fires at all units within a short-range conical field of fire. You move the cursor to define the field of fire and left-click to trigger the attack.
[p][h1]Meltdown (Special)[/h1][img:codex_meltdown]
[p]Any character with a disintegrator can perform the Meltdown special action, which fires a ray in a straight line through any number of targets until it hits a wall. You move the cursor to define the direction of fire and left-click to trigger the attack.
[p][h1]Knife Attack[/h1][img:codex_melee]
[p]Any character with a knife can perform the knife attack standard action when standing right next to an enemy unit. To do this, position the cursor over an enemy within the character’s field of attack (red) and left-click to trigger the attack.
[p][h1]Bleed (Special)[/h1][img:codex_bleed]
[p]Any character with a knife can perform the Bleed special action, which inflicts additional damage on the enemy in subsequent rounds. To do this, position the cursor over an enemy within the character’s field of attack (red) and left-click to trigger the attack.
[p][h1]Fist Punch[/h1][img:codex_punch]
[p]Characters without a knife can perform the standard action punch whilst standing adjacent to an enemy unit. When the action is selected, position the cursor over an enemy within the character’s field of attack (red) and left-click to execute. A punch only causes a small amount of damage.
[p][h1]Throw Grenade[/h1][img:codex_grenadethrow]
[p]Any character with a grenade can perform the Throw Grenade standard action. Position the cursor within the field of attack (red), select a target tile, and left-click to trigger the attack. The damage area is displayed.

[h1]Reload[/h1][img:codex_reload]
[p]Any character equipped with a ranged weapon can perform the Reload standard action. The weapon’s magazine is completely reloaded, provided you have sufficient ammunition.
[p][h1]Use Medkit[/h1][img:codex_healkit]
[p]Any character with Medkit can perform the Use Medkit standard action to heal themselves or their team members.  Left-click on a target in the field of effect (green) to trigger the healing. This action can be used to revive unconscious companions.
[p][h1]Use Repairkit[/h1][img:codex_repairkit]
[p]Any character with Repairkit can perform the Repair special action to repair their armor or a companion’s armor. Left-click on a target in the field of effect (green) to trigger the repair.
[p][h1]Low Profile (Special)[/h1][img:codex_lowprofile]
[p]Any character with medium armor can perform the Low Profile special action that grants them a significant evade bonus in the current and subsequent turn.
[p][h1]Hunker Down (Special)[/h1][img:codex_hunkerdown]
[p]Any character with heavy armor can perform the Hunker Down special action that significantly reduces all damage the character receives in the current and subsequent turn.

All types of damage other than armor piercing must first reduce any armor value to zero before they damage the health of their target.
[p][h1]Standard[/h1]Standard damage deals the same damage to health ([damage:Standard:0]%) and armor ([damage:Standard:1]%).
[p][h1]Splinter[/h1]Splinter damage is devastating to unarmored targets ([damage:Splinter:0]%), but receives a penalty against enemies wearing armor ([damage:Splinter:1]%). Shotguns inflict splinter damage by default, as do special models of other weapon classes.
[p][h1]Corrosion[/h1]Corrosion rays inflict high damage to armor ([damage:Corrosion:1]%), but receive a penalty against unarmored enemies ([damage:Corrosion:0]%). Only disintegrators can inflict corrosion damage.
[p][h1]Armor Piercing[/h1]Armor-piercing weapons ignore armor ([damage:ArmorPiercing:1]%) and instead apply all damage directly to the health of their target ([damage:ArmorPiercing:0]%). Special models of all weapon classes can inflict armor-piercing damage.

[h1]Advantages and disadvantages of different weapon classes[/h1]In Pathway, the characters can draw on an arsenal of five different ranged weapon classes and one melee weapon class. There is also one item class (grenades) that can be used to inflict damage.
[p]Each weapon has a specific chance to inflict a critical hit. Crits generate additional damage. The general crit chance varies from weapon class to weapon class, as described below.

[h1]Pistols[/h1]Pistols have large magazines and a high crit chance. However, they only inflict moderate standard damage at medium range and accuracy. Their Double Shot special action makes pistols an extremely flexible weapon class.
[p][img:codex_pistol]

[h1]Shotguns[/h1]Shotguns inflict high splinter damage but are very limited in terms of range, accuracy, crit chance and magazine size. Their Shotgun Blast special action is devastating to groups of nearby, unarmored opponents.
[p][img:codex_shotgun]

[h1]Assault Rifles[/h1]Assault rifles are mid-range weapons in terms of range, accuracy, crit chance and magazine size; they inflict average standard damage. Their Burst Fire special action is moderately flexible and can provide an effective means of dealing with groups of enemies at medium distance.
[p][img:codex_rifle]

[h1]Sniper Rifles[/h1]Sniper Rifles combine high accuracy and range with average crit chance, but they only have a small magazine and moderate standard damage. Their Ambush special action is a good way to control your enemies.
[p][img:codex_sniperrifle]

[h1]Disintegrators[/h1]Disintegrators inflict high corrosion damage, but they only have a moderate range and crit chance. They have a medium magazine size and accuracy. Their Meltdown special action is extremely dependent upon enemy positioning but in optimum conditions it provides an effective means of dealing with heavily armored enemies at almost any distance.
[p][img:codex_disintegrator]

[h1]Knives[/h1]Knives combine high standard damage with excellent crit chances, while requiring proximity with the enemy and all the risks that entails. The Bleed special action inflicts additional damage.
[p][img:codex_knife]

[h1]Grenades[/h1]Grenades inflict medium damage at medium distances. Weak and strong cover both provide complete protection from grenade shrapnel. Grenades can, however, bypass this protection if they are thrown behind the cover. Grenades cannot be targeted on cover tiles. They cause area damage, but no critical hits.
[p][img:codex_grenade]

[h1]The Valkyrium question[/h1]The German Reich’s secret obsession is called Valkyrium.
What is this strange substance? What powers does it grant those who possess it?
It seems the Nazis have found answers to these questions - terrible answers...
[p][img:codex_valkyrium]

[h1]Nazi Trooper[/h1]Armed with assault rifles, these jackbooted German troops are excellently equipped for battle in the desert. Nazi troopers are the backbone of the German expeditionary forces. Their discipline and resolve make them formidable opponents in any situation.
[p][img:codex_nazitroopers]

[h1]Attack dog[/h1]German attack dogs are fearsome beasts: Once they have latched on to their target, they will not let go until it is lying bleeding and defenseless in the desert sands. Unlike their masters, they have no concept of tactics and cover.
[p][img:codex_dogs]

[h1]Shock Trooper[/h1]Shock troopers are the most aggressive German troop contingent. Mobile and well-armored, they advance relentlessly to engage the enemy with their shotguns. Shock troopers are fearless and deadly close-quarters fighters.
[p][img:codex_shocktroopers]

[h1]Sniper[/h1]Unfortunately, there is not much cover that can reliably protect you from the accuracy of German snipers. While they are not particularly tough or mobile, they dominate the battlefield thanks to the superior range of their precision rifles.
[p][img:codex_snipers]

[h1]Medic[/h1]The uniform insignia of the German field medics makes them easily recognizable from afar. Their main task is to care for their wounded comrades – but that does not mean they don’t know how to use their service pistols...
[p][img:codex_medics]

[h1]Officer[/h1]German officers lead their troops with merciless discipline – the slightest of transgressions is met with severe punishment. Nevertheless, German officers have excellent tactical training – a German army unit will fight noticeably more efficiently if commanded by an officer.
[p][img:codex_officers]

[h1]Battle Hound[/h1]The Nazis must have done something unspeakable to these monstrous creatures! There is no training program in the world that could induce such implacable bloodlust. Not to mention their strangely lifeless eyes...
[p][img:codex_elitedogs]

[h1]Teslaborg[/h1]The absolute elite of terror. Stormtroopers of the German expeditionary forces. The Teslaborg is a steel nightmare in combat due to its monstrous armor and devastating firepower.
[p][img:codex_teslaborgs]

[h1]The menace in the shadows[/h1]The true goals of the Brotherhood of Khonesh remain shrouded in darkness - but that darkness is filled with loathsome rumors...
Rumors that rob you of your sleep and gnaw at the edges of your souls!
[p][img:codex_ring]

[h1]Cultist[/h1]The foot soldiers of the Brotherhood – fanatical, hate-filled and willing to fight to the death. Unlike their horrific undead allies, cultists fight tactically, use cover or flee when it makes sense. The cultists’ blazing sulfur pots rain death and destruction over their enemies.
[p][img:codex_cultists]

[h1]Zombie[/h1]What gives the Brotherhood its unholy power over the dead? One thing is certain: wherever they appear, the zombie hordes are not far behind. Tormented and mindless, they are driven by a constant hunger and hate for the living. Few things are as dangerous as an injured zombie...
[p][img:codex_zombies]

[h1]Infected[/h1]Death and destruction follow the Brotherhood wherever it goes. The infected clearly play an important role in their sinister plans. Bloated and decayed, they spread their sickness by spewing forth vile putrescence over their enemies.
[p][img:codex_infecteds]

[h1]Spore Bearer[/h1]With their unspeakable rituals, the Brotherhood have created a parasitic abomination that paralyzes its enemies in a cloud of poisonous spores. What affliction possesses these unfortunate souls? What final form will their metamorphosis reveal?
[p][img:codex_sporebearers]

[h1]High Priestess[/h1]Through years of study and ineffable practices, these abhorrent leaders of the Brotherhood have learned the darkest mysteries of the occult. They now command the secrets of life and death – they will not hesitate to unleash their unholy powers to achieve their goals...
[p][img:codex_highpriestesses]

[h1]Objective[/h1]The goal of each adventure is to reach the destination point of the map. On the way there, the team travels from location to location.
[p][img:codex_encounter]
[p][h1]Events[/h1]Each location presents a new event. The event may be a simple mood text without any gameplay consequences or more significant occurrences like loot, traders, resting places and challenging battles.
[p]Some events are short and to the point whilst others provide complex branching options. Character perks like Daredevil or Survivalist may open additional choices and event branches.
[p][h1]Fuel Reserves[/h1]The journey will slowly drain fuel reserves. Once depleted, you may give up or continue with the expedition on foot at the cost of the team's health.
[p][h1]Failure[/h1]The expedition fails as soon as the last of your characters dies either due to the harsh conditions of foot travel or at the hands of your enemies.

[h1]Turn-based Combat[/h1]Combat in Pathway is turn-based: The player first enters a planning phase in which they may place their characters inside a marked  area (green). The player and the enemy then each take their turns sequentially. The battle is over when one of the teams has lost all their units.
[p][img:codex_battleimpression]
[p]During their turn, the player can move their characters in any order. Once finished, the enemy proceeds to execute their actions in return.
[p][h1]Actions[/h1]Each unit can execute a maximum of two actions per turn: Attack and move are limited to one per turn. Neutral actions, such as reload or healing an allied character, can be done up to two times per turn.
[p]Each weapon and armor type provide a unique special ability to its user. They also require bravery points to use. Bravery is regenerated through various actions such as successful attacks and evades.
[p][h1]Covers[/h1]Characters positioned directly (not diagonally) next to cover receive some protection against ranged weapons. Weak and strong covers reduce the enemy's hitchance. Walls break the line of sight and therefore also prevent ranged attacks.
[p][h1]Heal, Repair, and Revive[/h1]If a character is equipped with medkits they may use it to heal nearby allies. Additionally, medkits can be used to revive unconscious characters. Units with repairkits may be used to repair armor during combat.

[h1]Pathway[/h1][h1]A game by Robotality[/h1][br]
[br]

Writing & Additional Game Design
[p][h2]Gavin Harrison[/h2]Music & Sound Design

You reach a rocky landscape, interspersed with rugged massifs. A vague smell of sulfur hangs in the air. As you are considering whether to avoid this inhospitable area, you spot a steaming waterhole surrounded by rocks.[CTP]

Turquoise crystals give the edge of the pool an unreal color. You cough as the swaths of acrid steam sting your throats. Do you want to take a short break or leave immediately?

After a short inspection, you establish that the water is pleasantly warm but completely unpalatable. An initial foot bath leads to a refreshing group bath in the steaming mineral spring.

The warm water burns slightly at your wounds, but by the time you get dressed, you all feel wonderfully invigorated.

As you relax at the edge of the pool and let your feet dangle into the water, you suddenly see large bubbles rising from the bottom of the waterhole. Moments later, a barely perceptible vibration shakes the ground beneath you! [CTP]

You dive for safety - and not a second too soon: a towering fountain of super-heated water shoots past you and into the air! Your reflexes saved you from the worst of it, but [char0] has been scalded.

The freshly churned up sand and the footprints around the entrance lead to just one conclusion: The ancient temple you have discovered here has visitors! [CTP]

You give in to your curiosity and carefully enter the old ruins. You soon spot a squad of soldiers at work on the walls of the altar room. They haven’t noticed you yet!

The ancient building in front of you has taken some rough treatment: Decorative elements have been thrown carelessly to the floor, the door has been forced open. Could the perpetrators still be inside the temple? You immediately decide to search for them. [CTP]

A short time later, you sneak up on a squad of soldiers. They remain oblivious to your approach, as they are tapping on the walls of the temple’s main hall. You realize they must be searching for secret doors.

Muted voices rise from the heart of the secluded temple complex. You draw your weapons and decide to get to the bottom of this mystery.

Unseen, you sneak up on a group of soldiers who have sought shelter from the scorching sun in the cool temple interior.

The footprints you have been following lead you to the foundations of a deserted temple. You carefully enter the structure to find out more about its mysterious visitors.

You soon discover a squad of exhausted soldiers camping in the temple interior. They haven’t seen you yet!

You are startled by loud, excited shouts! You approach the source of the commotion and spot a squad of soldiers entering a desert temple.

You wait a few minutes and then follow them. You come across them again in the central hall of the temple. They still have not noticed you!
You come across an abandoned desert temple. As you explore the structure, you encounter a squad of soldiers searching its halls. They have not noticed you yet!

The footprints you have been following lead to the foundations of a deserted temple. You carefully enter the structure to find out more about its mysterious visitors.

You soon discover a large unit of exhausted soldiers camping in the temple interior. They have not seen you yet!

You are startled by loud, excited shouts! You approach the source of the commotion and spot a large detachment of soldiers entering a desert temple.

You wait a few minutes and then follow them. You come across them again in the central hall of the temple. They still have not noticed you!
You come across an abandoned desert temple. As you explore the structure, you come across a large squad of soldiers searching its halls. They have not noticed you yet!

You come across a deserted temple, half buried in the desert sand. After a short inspection, you find the entrance and dare to enter the temple.[CTP]

You soon reach the central altar, when a noise startles you: You see a unit of soldiers with weapons drawn! It’s an ambush!

Beyond the next sand dune, ancient walls rise abruptly from the desert sands. It is a deserted temple! It does not take long to uncover the entrance. [CTP]

You set out to explore the complex – and run straight into a German ambush!

The temple in front of you looks desolate and deserted. It only takes you a few moments to get past the entrance.[CTP]

After looking around for a while, you finally make it to the altar room. Suddenly, you are ambushed by a unit of German soldiers who have been following you unnoticed!

Between the sand dunes, you come across the outer walls of a temple complex. The entrance is half buried in the sand, but you soon manage to excavate it.[CTP]

You explore the interior of the temple and finally enter the main vault. Unfortunately, you run directly into the guns of a squad of soldiers, who clearly found another way in!

The temple entrance has been smashed open using brute force. You ready your weapons and advance through the corridors until you finally arrive at the central room of the temple.[CTP]

Unfortunately, you were noisy enough to alert the German soldiers who are waiting in ambush!
Full of curiosity, you enter the temple you discovered in the endless expanse of the desert - and run straight into a German ambush. They must have seen you coming!

An ancient building rises from the desert sand ahead of you: an abandoned temple! You inspect the building and find an entrance. You carefully work your way through the corridors.

As you reach a spacious vault, you hear a shout! You have been discovered by a squad of German soldiers!

The entrance to the temple in front of you has been smashed in. You enter the building with weapons drawn. Once inside, your suspicions are confirmed: A group of German soldiers are camping here! They have seen you!

The ancient, dilapidated building in front of you may once have been a temple. Curious, you start to explore it.

As you enter the altar room, you see a bored-looking German sentry leaning against a wall. He spots you too and alerts his comrades!

Even from a distance, the silhouette of the temple breaks the monotony of the desert horizon. As you enter its cool interior, you suddenly hear footsteps ahead of you. [CTP] 

Before you can react, a German soldier comes around the corner! He immediately dives for cover and alerts the rest of his unit! You must fight for your lives!

A lonely desert temple rises from the dunes ahead of you. The entrance is half buried, but you manage to squeeze through.[CTP]

Inside, you find a squad of German soldiers around an improvised excavation site. You are spotted immediately and the enemy soldiers open fire!
As you explore the ancient temple you discovered among the desert dunes, you run straight into a detachment of soldiers! They are just as surprised as you are!
The camp in the ruins ahead of you seems deserted, until you realize the truth: You have fallen into an ambush!

You see an abandoned camp among some ruins. The campfire is no longer lit, but the ashes are fresh. Just how recent is this camp?[CTP]

As if in response to your unspoken question, you hear a rustle behind you. You spin around to see a detachment of soldiers pointing their rifles at you! You have walked into an ambush!

The old camp in the ruins ahead of you seems deserted. You are not sure whether to trust in the apparent peacefulness of this place... [CTP]

Suddenly, a detachment of soldiers emerges from the shadows with weapons drawn and mocking grins on their faces! You have walked into an ambush!

You come across a burnt-out campfire among some abandoned ruins. A last wisp of smoke rises lazily into the air. The camp looks like it was abandoned in a hurry – what happened here? [CTP]

You hear the sound of jackboots behind you – to your dismay, you realize: You have walked into a German ambush!

From a distance, you spot an abandoned military camp among the ruins. All signs point to a hasty departure. Hoping to find more clues, you start to investigate the camp.[CTP]

Only when German soldiers appear all around you with weapons drawn, do you realize that you have been ambushed!

You find the remains of a hastily abandoned camp in the ruins ahead of you. You make a quick search of the camp when you suddenly spot a movement out of the corner of your eye! [CTP]

You look up and realize that you have been ambushed by a unit of German soldiers!
The unit of soldiers in the ruins ahead are completely unaware of you – an ambush is the last thing they expect!
A group of soldiers is encamped in some ruins up ahead of you. They have not noticed you yet!
You stumble across a German military camp. The soldiers lounge around listlessly in the ruins – they have not noticed you!
From afar you hear commands echoing in the desert air. You sneak closer and find a squad of soldiers setting up camp among some ruins.
The large detachment of soldiers in the ruins ahead of you did not think it necessary to set up guards as they clearly feel secure in their numerical advantage!
There is a large group of soldiers in the ruins up ahead of you. They do not appear to have noticed you yet!
As you walk around a ruined building, an enemy sentry spots you and sounds the alarm! You have startled a unit of German soldiers who are camping among the ruins!
Up ahead of you, a detachment of German soldiers are hunkered down among the ruins! They have seen you and are running for cover! Moments later, they open fire!
You hear a shout and a unit of soldiers jump up from the shadows of the ruins. You dive for cover – moments later the bullets begin to fly!

You don’t see the soldiers resting among the ruins until you are almost on top of them – they are as surprised as you are! They frantically grab their weapons and open fire! You rush for cover and return fire!

The soldiers in the ruins up ahead have not noticed you yet, so you decide to withdraw.[CTP]

Suddenly, you hear a shout: The guards have spotted you! The Germans grab their weapons as you dive for cover!
As you approach the ruins, you hear a loud shout! The soldiers ahead of you are as surprised as you are!

You come across some crumbling ruins, possibly a long-abandoned caravansary. The desert wind and the scorching heat have not been kind to the blasted buildings.[CTP]

In the overgrown courtyard you find a dried-up well. You discover some rough steps that lead down the well shaft. The sand around the well has been churned up by numerous footprints.

The mysterious well has triggered your interest. Without further ado, you climb down the stone protrusions that are built into the side of the well. After wandering the underground tunnels, you see the glow of several torches flickering on the walls of the vault ahead of you. Soon you hear loud, menacing voices. [CTP]

You peer carefully around the corner – to see a large group of German soldiers! In the middle of the group stands a prisoner who is being questioned aggressively by the soldiers. They are so engrossed in the interrogation that they do not notice you. You pause to decide what to do.
You have an uneasy feeling about the old well. After a short pause, you continue on your journey.
Silently, you sneak closer, scurrying from cover to cover. As soon as you are in position, you open fire!

It’s a bold plan – but it might just work. The soldiers bind their prisoner and then withdraw to their camp to consult out of earshot.[CTP]

[char0] dashes forwards from cover to cover until he finally reaches the prisoner! You see [char0] cut the bonds around the captive's ankles.

Even from a distance, you can see that something is wrong in the village ahead of you, so you approach cautiously, using the low walls for cover. [CTP]

Your instincts did not deceive you: A group of German soldiers have occupied the village and are rounding up its inhabitants!
You check your ammunition and take your positions. Then you open fire! The farmers seek shelter in their huts when the Germans return fire.

As the last shot dies away, the villagers cautiously emerge from their huts. The village elder thanks you profusely. Then he points despondently at the village well: [CTP]

[char1]: "The soldiers destroyed our well! Help us, or our livestock will die of thirst! "

You peer into the well shaft and realize that it has been blown up by a German hand grenade.
You hope the farmers will be able to dig their own well again, because you don’t have time to do it for them. Regretfully, you bid farewell and move on.

The narrow stone passageway leads ever deeper. After a while, you finally notice a change in the gradient: The passageway is leading upward again! [CTP]

Step by step you feel your way forward, when one of the flagstones suddenly shifts under your weight with an unpleasant grating sound. You hear a faint click and see a round, man-sized boulder come loose from the wall and start rolling slowly towards you!

As you travel through the endless desert, you see a small herd of wild camels on your right, plodding across the dunes in the distance. You see a mother camel with its foal, both as white as freshly driven snow, lagging behind the rest of the herd.

After a few minutes, the shy animals turn and disappear among the dunes.
A traveling merchant has set up camp at this oasis. When he sees you, he hastily spreads out his wares and gesticulates wildly in your direction.

The palm grove is pleasantly shady. As you relax and enjoy the shade, a cobra suddenly rears up from between some boulders! [CTP]

Hidden in a dry river bed, you find a waterhole with a few date palms growing at its banks. The date palms are heavy with fruit, so you decide to take a break in this shady spot.

After a desperate flight you finally reach the open air. 

You dive into your jeep and step on the accelerator before the cultists can seize you!

Minutes later, [char2] notices he is clutching a richly embroidered bag. 

He must have torn it from the priestess in the melee! As you rifle through its exotic contents for any clues, you find a strange letter that was originally dispatched in Paris.

Minutes later, [char2] notices she is clutching a richly embroidered bag. 

She must have torn it from the priestess in the melee! As you rifle through its exotic contents for any clues, you find a strange letter that was originally dispatched in Paris.

When you search the priestess, you discover a richly embroidered bag slung over her shoulder. You rifle through its exotic contents in search of clues and find a strange letter that was originally dispatched in Paris.

"Beloved Sisters!

The rumors are true. Our brothers and sisters in Moscow have failed to complete their mission! No doubt the Politburo will soon hold a show trial under some trumped up charges." [CTP]

"The High Lodge is unable to intervene, but our time will come!

This latest development, together with our retreat from London, represents a considerable setback but not a catastrophe.

Do not despair!" [CTP]

"Our chapters in New York and San Francisco are now well established and we have made significant progress in Berlin: with each day the completion of our Great Work draws closer!"
There is nothing of interest here.

Head bowed, you stare silently ahead of you. When you finally sit down exhausted, you feel totally drained. 

So tired... [CTP]

You look up at the sound of soft paws in the desert sands. 

Emerging from between the rocks you spot a German shepherd dog. Instinctively you reach for your weapon, but the animal appears to be alone, just like you. 

Hesitantly, the black dog trots towards you and sniffs at you suspiciously.

As you scratch at his neck, you find a German dog tag:

[char0]: "Fenris, huh? Did they treat you badly, you little deserter?"

The dog yaps eagerly, as if in agreement. He then pants excitedly and wags his tail. [CTP]

A wave of confidence flows through you. 

You get in the car and pat encouragingly on the passenger seat.

[char0]: "Come on, boy! We’ve got work to do..."

You sit down in the sand, exhausted. 

Profound despair rises slowly from deep within you. 

Could this be the end of your journey? [CTP]

A fleeting movement at the edge of your field of vision shakes you from your gloomy thoughts. 

You look up and see a snow-white wolfhound peering at you from the shadows of the rocks.

You carefully reach into your breast pocket and fish out the rock-hard donut you had been saving for a special occasion. 

The shy creature hesitates first, but then creeps forward suspiciously. [CTP] 

With ravenous hunger, it devours the donut and licks your hands clean with its rough tongue. You feel your will to live returning as the animal nuzzles at you. [CTP]

You open the passenger door and wave the dog in:

[char0]: "Donut, I think this might be the beginning of a beautiful friendship..."

Shaking your head, you stand by the grave you just dug for your four-legged friend – it all seems so pointless...

Don't people usually say a prayer at times like these? 

You rack your heat-addled brains for something fitting but nothing comes to you.

In the end, you improvise: 

[char0]: "Fenris was a loyal companion."

No, that's not good enough! You clear your throat and start again:

[char0]: "Fenris was a true friend. He died as he lived: free and proud. We will miss him forever." [CTP]

We? 

Tormented, you laugh. Who are you kidding out here in this wasteland? 

Forgotten and alone, your journey ends here...

[char0]: "Donut, old girl! Come on, we need to get going!"

But Donut doesn't move; the animal lies on its side, panting. 

The helpless look in her gentle eyes shakes you to the core. [CTP]

You look away and feverishly scour your pockets for something to eat. 

There! An old ship's biscuit!

But you look up again into Donut's lifeless gaze and something breaks inside you. 

You struggle to maintain your composure, but there's no denying it: Your journey together has come to an end. 

It’s time to admit defeat...

You squat helplessly in the sand next to your jeep and stare into the distance.

You scan the endless horizon, then shake your head: No, you are the only human being for many miles. [CTP]

Continuing your journey alone through this desolate wilderness would be your certain end!

You sigh.

Maybe this is a good time to see how your radio has weathered the rigors of the journey...

You did your best, but in the end, the enemy won! 

Somebody else will have to save Morten from his fate...

You did your best, but in this race there is no second place!

Hopefully someone else can prevent The Wrath of God from falling into the hands of the Nazis...

Unfortunately, you did not manage to thwart the Brotherhood's blasphemous plans!

Who can prevent the return of the Black Pharaoh now? You do not know...

You fought to the bitter end, but you lost!

Perhaps somebody else will look into the secrets of the German expedition to the holy Mount Sinai...

You did your best, but you were unable to solve the mystery of Kharga Serabit!

Fabulous images of the magnificent desert city are the last thing that passes through your mind as you sink, exhausted, into the sand...

Everything blurs before your eyes. The Divine Chariot, the Queen of Sheba - was any of it true, or have you been chasing the imaginings of a fever dream all this time?

Dream or reality - your journey ends here...

In the distance you see what looks like an old temple structure. You stop to investigate and realise the entrance has caved in long ago.
You pass an old abandoned mine entrance. It is not accessible.
You notice a bunker in the distance. On closer inspection you realise it is locked tight.
Not far from the road you see an old water cistern. It is completely dried up.
On your next break you stop near a beautiful rock formation.
You stop near an old-growth tree before continuing your journey.
You come to halt near a half buried jeep. You quickly realise that there's nothing to be found here.
Promising colours in the distance turned out to be nothing but a mount of useless trash dumped here.
A few crates in the sand piqued your interest, but nothing of value could be found.
As you come around the corner you see a couple of rusty fuel canisters in the ground. They turn out to be completely empty.
The boundless desert in front of you is a sight to behold. Soon you continue your journey.
You are stopped by a lonely camel crossing the road. You let it pass and continue.
As you stop to stretch your legs you hear the bleat of a goat in the distance. You shrug and keep going.
A single sheep passes near your jeep. After a quick stop you drive off.
Halting near a group of bushes, you suddenly notice a snake slithering next to your feet. You cautiously move on.
A structure in the distance turns out to be a tattered Nazi tent. Nothing of value remains and you leave.
Around the next corner you discover a recently built tent. The skulls strewn on the ground are enough to make you leave this place quickly.
An old altar appears over the next dune. All the dried blood is making you feel uneasy and you move on.
The hills around you are filled with big bushes. You journey on after a quick stop.
Not far from your last stop you notice a pile of books - none of them in a readable state. Disappointed you leave.
When you halt next, you are surprised to find a few skulls buried in the sandy ground around you. You leave wondering what had taken place here.
A row of speared skulls make you stop your jeep. After a few minutes you have satisfied your curiousity and you continue your travels.
In the middle of the road you find an old map - it is completely undecipherable. You keep going.
You stop near some worn down stone structures. After a short while you drive off.
A long gone cold campfire gives you reason to stop and take a deep breath. Not wanting to waste time you depart again.
You stop the jeep immediately upon noticing a metalic object in the ground. You decide it is useless trash and leave.
As you stop you look upon a single lonely cactus growing in the desert. Shaking your heads you continue.
As soon as you notice the nazi flag you stop immediately and look around for danger. Soon you realise it is just an abandoned flag and leave.
Between a handful of rocks you are temporarily fascinated by a spider nest. Soon you jump back in your jeep and drive off.
You stop and notice the grassy patches covering the ground around you. You depart.
The old radio you noticed next to the tree turns out to be completely broken. You start your engines again and leave.

Agile Melee fighter, flexible upgrade paths

Casablanca, Morocco: 
You receive a desperate plea for help – your old friend Morten has been abducted by the Nazis and taken to the Moroccan desert!
You decide to travel to North Africa immediately to find Morten before the Germans execute him!

You take a break in a provincial backwater, a few miles beyond Casablanca. This is the last outpost of civilization – beyond this point is nothing but merciless desert. Morten is out there somewhere...
Chattering excitedly, you stroll back to your jeep. You get in and drive into the setting sun while Morten entertains you with his absurd anecdotes.

Jerusalem, Palestine:
Morten was quite right: The Nazis are up to something sinister…
That's why you are hot on the heels of a German expedition to Mount Ararat. They are searching for a mysterious object known as the Wrath of God. 
Foil their plans!
Your vantage point on the hill provides an excellent view of the heights and valleys of Palestine. A large cloud of dust on the dirt track below marks out a large German convoy.
The Wrath of God! The artifact should be buried forever under tons of rock - your only consolation is that the Nazis will never get their hands on it...

Cairo, Egypt:
The wild rumours circulating among local occultists over the past few weeks lead you to one terrifying conclusion:
The unholy cultists of the Khonesh Brotherhood plan to reawaken Turash-Ra, the Black Pharaoh! 
You travel to the stone desert of Meroe to stop them!

You leave the hustle and noise of Cairo behind you; before you stretch the lazy bends of the Nile, lifeline of ancient Egypt. The mighty river disappears into the eternal expanse of the Egyptian desert.
Your engine roars as you leave the pyramid behind forever! Turash-Ra will never see the light of day again...

Port Said, Egypt:
A Nazi expedition has joined forces with the Brotherhood! They are planning an unholy ritual on Mount Sinai. Who knows what evil they intend to summon? You fear the worst!
Why are the Germans working with the Brotherhood? What are they planning on Mount Sinai? Will you be able to thwart their plans?
Confused, you prepare to head back down. Maybe not every riddle needs to be solved...

Jeddah, Arabia:
With his dying breath, the old caravan guide swore that he had seen Kharga Serabit with his own eyes. Kharga Serabit, swallowed by the desert sands so many millennia ago!
The very next day, you set off on a journey that leads you deep into the heart of the merciless desert!

The dusty desert path leads you out of Jeddah, away from the lush greenery of its walled gardens and the turquoise waves of the Red Sea that break against the gleaming white quay walls of the proud harbor city.
Gritting your teeth, you turn your back on this cursed place forever to set out on your long journey to the coast...

Djibouti, East Africa:
The cultists of the Khonesh Brotherhood are searching the Abyssinian Highlands for the final resting place of the Queen of Sheba. According to legend, her temple grave is the repository of the Divine Chariot, Merkabah. 
You must stop them!
You sigh with relief as your dilapidated sailboat approaches the massive harbor walls of Djibouti: Dry land under your feet again at last!
Sighing, you start your journey back - all the richer for this mysterious experience...

On the exploration map you can manage your party by pressing I or clicking on the bottom bar.
Once you are engaged in a battle you can't switch your gear. Choose wisely!
Every weapon and armor type has a unique special ability that can make the difference between success and failure!
If one of your party members is knocked out you can bring them back by using a medkit on them when standing next to them. If you wait too long, they will die!
You can use medkits outside of battle by right-clicking them on the team screen!
Sell your unused items at the trader by right-clicking them. The cash will come in handy later!
Keep an eye on your ammo and fuel count. If you run out of either resource you will be in trouble!
Every member of your party can perform two actions in one turn. There are three types of actions: Attack, Move and Neutral. Attack and Move can only be done once a turn, Neutral up to two.
Cover reduces your chance of hitting a target. If you can aim at a target without cover you have a 100% hit chance. Flanking your enemies is one of the best strategies!
Use walls and large objects to your advantage as they break the line of sight.
Armor always absorbs damage first. It is especially effective against splinter damage weapons like Shotguns!
There is a small chance for you to evade an attack independent of hit probability.
Every character can carry three items at once: One Weapon, one auxiliary item and one armor. Picking the right gear largely determines your strategy.
A character begins with a unique set of skills. As they gain experience and level up they will be able to unlock new perks and skills.
In order to equip a weapon a character must have the appropriate skill.
Some perks will open up new choices during events. These unique options are marked with an extra border.
Pistols have the special ability Double Shot. This performs a hip shot at two enemies in rapid succession!
Sniper Rifles can be used to set an Ambush. An enemy moving or planning to attack within the ambush area will be attacked!
Rifles allow you to Burst attack. A burst will spread across multiple tiles in a line and damage any units within.
Shotguns can perform a powerful Blast attack, damaging all units in a cone straight in front of you.
Knives have a special ability called Bleed, which as the name indicates will cause enemies to bleed over a couple of turns.
All special abilities cost bravery points. You can gain bravery points by successfully attacking, evading enemy attacks, healing your units, and repairing their armors.
Knives have the highest damage potential in the game. You must however expose yourself by moving close!
Sniper Rifles can cover large areas with their high range.
Some battle locations contain explosive barrels. Shoot them and they will explode causing damage to surrounding enemies!
Medkits restore health and revive unconscious characters. Repairkits restore armor.
You can perform your actions during battle in any order!
Don't forget to take your loot with you after a successful battle!
Knives are a great backup option for when you run out of ammo!
Light Armors enable your character to use the ability Sprint allowing them to cover a much longer distance in one move.
Medium Armors give your character the Low Profile ability. When activated, the character receives a temporary Evade boost.
Heavy Armors allow your character to Hunker Down. It temporarily reduces all damage taken!
When your character is out of moves a little tick will appear next to their vitals just above the head.
You can see your character's and your enemy's basic vitals hovering above their head.
Hovering over a location on the exploration map will reveal some basic info about that location.
Resting places, traders and recruiting events can be revisited.
If you are at a location that can be revisited (such as a trader), simply click on it again to revisit.
